intro: Hyptiodaphne crassifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its evergreen foliage, which consists of thick, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in spring. Hyptiodaphne crassifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it adaptable to various garden settings.
